hanzi-su-wiki:
諸

Значения

Все, всяческие

Мнемоника

Все те 者, о которых идёт речь 言.

Варианты

諸, 诸
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhū
surname Zhu; all; various
фамилия Чжу; все; разные
rtega_mnemonic:
諸諸RS
诸诸		several, various
  • person 者 saying 言 several things
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 诸)
Pictophonetic: 者 indicates the sound; 言 (speech) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
諸多 [ zhū duō ]: (used for abstract things) a good deal, a lot of
諸如 [ zhū rú ]: (various things) such as; such as (the following)
諸位 [ zhū wèi ]: (pron) everyone; Ladies and Gentlemen; Sirs
諸侯 [ zhū hóu ]: feudal vassal; feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC; subordinate warlord; local official
諸葛亮 [ zhū gě liàng ]: Zhuge Liang (181-234), military leader and prime minister of Shu Han 蜀汉 during the Three Kingdoms period; the main hero of the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三国演义 , where he is portrayed as a sage and military genius; mastermind
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 者 [ zhě ] that which; they who; those who
heisig_chinese_memo: Because i get tired of saying the same old thing, I have lately been trying to use various terms of endearment to my puppet. I think she appreciates it too.
heisig_constituent: various, say, words, keitai, mouth, someone, puppet, sooty, old man, sun, day
koohiiStory1: Because i get tired of saying the same old thing, I have lately been trying to use various terms of endearment to my love doll. I think she appreciates it too.
koohiiStory2: When you pull the string at the back of Chucky, he will say various things. "Hidey-ho! Ha ha ha!" "Hi, I´m Chucky. Wanna play?" "I´m going to eat your liver, bitch!".
jp_example_words:
諸(しょ): various, many, several
諸君(しょくん): Gentlemen!, Ladies!
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: They say someone with various talents is important. Various talents can include speaking various languages so if you are someone who knows various languages you can say things that various peoples will comprehend.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You are someone who can say things in various languages. Speak some of these various languages now. You are someone who is good at saying things. Nice job.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You’re so good at speaking various languages that you decide to put on a show (しょ). At the show, you say a lot of things in various languages and everyone is impressed.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine yourself at this show. The spotlight is on and all eyes are watching. You feel kind of nervous, but you speak the various languages with ease.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 緒 (お、いとぐち、ショ кончик нити, зацепка)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the person's (者) words (言) are various
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: My puppet is an interesting one to talk to because she has various words to say about almost any topic.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscriptions of the Warring States Period from " yan " to " zhe ", used as other words and pronouns. Qin Zhaoliang: "Princes", "Princes" refer to the monarchs of the countries during the Spring and Autumn Period and Warring States Period. Meanwhile, Jin again, " who " to " all " see " those ." " Zhu " and " zhe " were originally a variant of the word, but later each expressed its meaning and gradually divided into two characters. " Zhu " is a frequently used word in ancient Chinese. Some words, such as " Zhu ", are still used today. "Shuowen": "All, debate. From the voice."

The usage of other things can be found in the pre-Qin classics, such as "Book of Rites‧ Jiao Special Sacrifice": "I don't know where the god is, where is it? Where is it, or people from far away?" Another example is "Zuo Zhuan‧ Nine Years of Xi Gong": "Public illness, call it, and say: "I think it is to despise the orphans and humiliate the doctor, how can it be?"" Wang Yinzhi, "Survey on the Scriptures-Chunqiu Zuo Zhuan 1": "The present case: the word for all Also, Zhe is connected with all ancient characters."

Pronoun usage is also found in the pre-Qin literature, such as "Zuo Zhuan‧Wen AD Year": "What can you do?" Du pre-annotated: "Ask if you can do anything." Yang Bojun's note: "Zhu is used as the word "Zhi"."

" Zhu " can also be used as a preposition, which is equivalent to " Yu ", as in the Book of Rites: Sacrificing Righteousness: "My filial piety is sent to the court and walks the road."

The pre-Qin literature also often used " Zhu " to mean many and each. For example, "Poetry‧ Xiaoya‧ Mianshui": "My brothers, friends of the people, Moken to read chaos, who has no parents!" "Book of Rites-Sacrifice": "The righteous husband is the cause of the aspirations, the hair of all virtues Yeah.” Kong Yingdashu: “Everybody, everybody.”

" Zhu " can also mean the combination of " Zhi " and " Yu ", such as "Book of Rites-Tan Gong Shang": "Brother, I cry to the temples." Another example is Song Minqiu's "Chunming Retirement Records" under the volume: "Nai Ji Zhuanji, the Fu for eight years after passing the school, use empty names to condense it." It also means the combination of " Zhi " and " Hu ", such as "Twenty-three Years of Zuo Zhuan·Xi Gong": "Jin Gong Zi There are three Yan, or Tianqi will be built? Jun Qili Yan!"

" Zhu " also has the meaning of everything, as in "Guanzi·Qingzhongding": "Those who are entrusted by the emperor to Taishan and meditate on the father of Liang will embrace the jingmao bunch as a Zen book." Ma Feibaixin interprets Xu Weiqiu Said: "Everything, it's still everywhere."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The Bronze inscriptions of the Warring States Period from " yan " to " zhe ", used as other words and pronouns.
humanum_full_description:
戰國金文從「言」從「者」，用作別事詞、代詞。秦詔量：「諸侯」，「諸侯」指春秋戰國時期列國的國君。同時，金文又以「者」為「諸」，參見「者」。「諸」、「者」原為一字異體，後各表其義，逐漸分化成兩個字。「諸」在古漢語中屬使用頻率很高的常用詞，有的詞彙，如「諸位」，沿用至今。《說文》：「諸，辯也。从言者聲。」

　　別事詞用法見於先秦典籍，如《禮記‧郊特牲》：「不知神之所在，於彼乎？於此乎，或諸遠人乎？」又如《左傳‧僖公九年》：「公疾，召之，曰：『以是藐諸孤，辱在大夫，其若之何？』 」王引之《經義述聞‧春秋左傳上》：「今案：諸即者字也，者與諸古字通。」

　　代詞用法也見於先秦文獻，如《左傳‧文公元年》：「能事諸乎？」杜預注：「問能事職不。」楊伯峻注：「‘諸’作『之』字用。」

　　「諸」也可用作介詞，相當於「於」，如《禮記‧祭義》：「孝弟發諸朝廷，行乎道路。」

　　先秦文獻還常用「諸」表示眾、各個。如《詩‧小雅‧沔水》：「嗟我兄弟，邦人諸友，莫肯念亂，誰無父母！」《禮記‧祭統》：「夫義者所以濟志也，諸德之發也。」孔穎達疏：「諸，眾也。」

　　「諸」還可表示「之」與「於」的合音，如《禮記‧檀弓上》：「兄弟，吾哭諸廟。」又如宋代宋敏求《春明退朝錄》卷下：「乃稽諸版籍，通校大數八年之賦，舉空名以斂之」；亦表示「之」與「呼」的合音，如《左傳‧僖公二十三年》：「晉公子有三焉，天其或者將建諸？君其禮焉！」

　　「諸」還有凡是之義，如《管子‧輕重丁》：「諸從天子封於太山，禪於梁父者，必抱菁茅一束以為禪籍。」馬非百新詮引許維遹曰：「諸，猶凡也。」
humanum_short_description: 戰國金文從「言」從「者」，用作別事詞、代詞。

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 者 indicates the sound; 言 (speech) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 者 [ zhě ] that which; they who; those who
①衆，許多：諸位。諸君。諸侯。
②“之於”或“之乎”的合音：投諸渤海之尾。
③猶“之”：“能事諸乎？”
④猶“於”：“宋人事資章甫適諸越”。
⑤語助，無實在意義：“日居月諸，照臨下土”。
⑥姓氏。

諸(しょ): various, many, several
諸君(しょくん): Gentlemen!, Ladies!

戰國金文從「 言 」從「 者 」，用作別事詞、代詞。秦詔量：「諸侯」，「諸侯」指春秋戰國時期列國的國君。同時，金文又以「 者 」為「 諸 」，參見「 者 」。「 諸 」、「 者 」原為一字異體，後各表其義，逐漸分化成兩個字。「 諸 」在古漢語中屬使用頻率很高的常用詞，有的詞彙，如「諸位」，沿用至今。《說文》：「諸，辯也。从言者聲。」 別事詞用法見於先秦典籍，如《禮記‧郊特牲》：「不知神之所在，於彼乎？於此乎，或諸遠人乎？」又如《左傳‧僖公九年》：「公疾，召之，曰：『以是藐諸孤，辱在大夫，其若之何？』 」王引之《經義述聞‧春秋左傳上》：「今案：諸即者字也，者與諸古字通。」 代詞用法也見於先秦文獻，如《左傳‧文公元年》：「能事諸乎？」杜預注：「問能事職不。」楊伯峻注：「‘諸’作『之』字用。」 「 諸 」也可用作介詞，相當於「 於 」，如《禮記‧祭義》：「孝弟發諸朝廷，行乎道路。」 先秦文獻還常用「 諸 」表示眾、各個。如《詩‧小雅‧沔水》：「嗟我兄弟，邦人諸友，莫肯念亂，誰無父母！」《禮記‧祭統》：「夫義者所以濟志也，諸德之發也。」孔穎達疏：「諸，眾也。」 「 諸 」還可表示「 之 」與「 於 」的合音，如《禮記‧檀弓上》：「兄弟，吾哭諸廟。」又如宋代宋敏求《春明退朝錄》卷下：「乃稽諸版籍，通校大數八年之賦，舉空名以斂之」；亦表示「 之 」與「 呼 」的合音，如《左傳‧僖公二十三年》：「晉公子有三焉，天其或者將建諸？君其禮焉！」 「 諸 」還有凡是之義，如《管子‧輕重丁》：「諸從天子封於太山，禪於梁父者，必抱菁茅一束以為禪籍。」馬非百新詮引許維遹曰：「諸，猶凡也。」

諸字的基本解释

諸
zhū
见“诸”。

諸字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhū］
［《廣韻》章魚切，平魚，章。］
“诸1”的繁体字。
(1)辩，问辩。
(2)别事词。相当于“者”。
(3)众；各个。
(4)凡是。
(5)别的；其他。
(6)犹庶。亲属的旁支。
(7)代词。相当于“之”。用作宾语。
(8)代词。相当于“其”。用作定语。
(9)介词。相当于“於”。
(10)语助词。表感叹。
(11)语助词。用于句中。
(12)代词“之”和介词“於”的合音。
(13)代词“之”和疑问语气词“乎”的合音。
(14)干果。
(15)通“都”。参见“諸頭”、“諸邊”。
(16)古邑名。春秋鲁地。在今山东省诸城县西南。
(17)姓。《广韵》又正奢切，職余切。汉代有诸於。见洪迈《容斋五笔》引汉应劭《风俗通》。
[②]［chú］
［《字彙》常如切］
“诸2”的繁体字。
蟾蜍。

諸字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　諸； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1172第04
〔古文〕?【唐韻】【廣韻】章魚切【集韻】【類篇】【韻會】【正韻】專於切，?渚平聲。【說文】辯也。【徐曰】別異之辭。【爾雅·釋訓】諸諸，便便，辯也。【註】皆言辭辯給也。　又【玉篇】非一也。皆言也。【正韻】凡衆也。【書·舜典】歷試諸艱。【詩·邶風】孌彼諸姬。【史記·賈誼傳】紛亂諸事。　又【廣雅】之也，於也。【穀梁傳·莊二十四年】迎者行見諸，舍見諸。【註】諸，之也。【禮·射義】射求正諸己。【註】諸，猶於也。　又【韻會】語助辭。【詩·邶風】日居月諸。【疏】居，諸，語助也。【公羊傳·桓六年】其諸以病桓與。【註】其諸，辭也。　又【韻會】有諸，疑辭。【孟子】文王之囿方七十里，有諸。　又于諸，寘也。【公羊傳·哀六年】?乞使人迎陽生，于諸其家。【註】齊人語也。　又諸侯，國君也。【易·比卦】先王以建萬國，親諸侯。　又官名。【周禮·夏官】諸子。【註】主公卿大夫士之子者。或曰庶子。　又神名。【淮南子·地形訓】諸稽攝提條風之所生也。又諸比，凉風之所生也。【註】皆天神名。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhū］
["Guangyun" octopus cut, flat fish, chapter. ]
Traditional characters of "诸1".
(1) Defend, ask and argue.
(2) Say nothing. Equivalent to "者".
(3) All; each.
(4) Anything.
(5) Others; Others.
(6) Yushu. Side branch of relatives.
(7) Pronouns. Equivalent to "of". Used as an object.
(8) Pronouns. Equivalent to "its". Used as an attributive.
(9) Prepositions. Equivalent to "Y".
(10) Auxiliary words. Table sighs.
(11) Auxiliary words. Used in sentences.
(12) The combination of the pronoun "zhi" and the preposition "于".
(13) The consonance of the pronoun "zhi" and the interrogative particle "hu".
(14) Dried fruits.
(15) Through "Du". See "Zhutou", "Zhubian".
(16) The name of the ancient town. Spring and Autumn Lu land. In today's southwest of Zhucheng County, Shandong Province.
(17) Last name. "Guang Yun" is extravagantly cut again, after-work. There are many in the Han Dynasty. See Hong Mai's "Rongzhai Wubi" quoted by Han Yingshao's "Funsutong".
[②]［chú］
["Words" often like cutting]

Name meaning

zhū
вм. 诸
Radicals: 言, 者  (say, someone)
Meaning Mnemonic
They say someone with various talents is important. Various talents can include speaking various languages so if you are someone who knows various languages you can say things that various peoples will comprehend.
You are someone who can say things in various languages. Speak some of these various languages now. You are someone who is good at saying things. Nice job.
Reading Mnemonic
You’re so good at speaking various languages that you decide to put on a show (しょ). At the show, you say a lot of things in various languages and everyone is impressed.
Imagine yourself at this show. The spotlight is on and all eyes are watching. You feel kind of nervous, but you speak the various languages with ease.
